body: Superseded by #1999.

> 

Unfortunately, RC's are a non-starter for production environments

@curtiscook I'm afraid you may be stuck waiting for the next general release of Tinkerpop. Unfortunately I don't have any answers as to when the next release may come. I'm not aware of any official release discussions taking place yet, the [developer maillist](mailto:dev@tinkerpop.apache.org) is the best place to watch for this. Looking at past release dates, I would guess that a new release in the next 1-2 months is likely but it's not something I can guarantee.

Thanks @danielcweber! I think the user agent was introduced in 3.5-dev, do you mind rebasing to 3.5-dev instead?  Otherwise LGTM. VOTE +1.
For .NET, this code was only introduced in 3.6.2 and is not in 3.6.1. Still rebase?
I see it's already on 3.5.5 too. So I'll rebase.

thanks for looking into this further. unfortunately, it's creating more questions. Not sure how others feel but I'm hesitant to include another dependency here to solve this, especially a deprecated one that is not maintained anymore. it's also changing gryo which would make server backward incompatible with drivers, e.g. 3.5.6 server would stop working with a 3.5.5 driver. gryo is deprecated i suppose but i'd say it remains a concern in my mind. 

Given those issues, I'd like this approach to be a last resort and even then I'd consider relegating it to a newer version that doesn't break compatibility. Do you feel like we have reached a position of last resort at this point? If so, could you share other approaches you've tried that didn't really work well?

thanks for your patience on this - sometimes the smallest bugs can be a nuisance to fix and generate a lot of discussion.

`Writing` and `Deleting` aren't really marker interface only, because `Mutating` isn't. `Mutating` brings with it the `Event` subsystem for `EventStrategy`. I don't think that will work well with `io()` or `call()`. I think that providers will just need to account for those steps as special cases rather than test them for `Writing` or `Deleting`. for example analyzing `call()` bytecode might require the additional check of examining the service being called for that step to determine its action. so, long story short, it was good to call those steps out, but i don't think they can implement any part of the `Mutating` interface the way it is defined. VOTE +1

yes - the `Graph` should get set once now when all strategies are completely applied, but it also means that the `Graph` might not be set in between strategy applications, so if a strategy needs `Graph` the only place it can be sure it will find it is in the root traversal.
